availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles N. Davis (Carter County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farm hand and soldier. Carter County, Kentucky, native. Son of Moses Davis and Mildred F. Davis. Resident of Lewis County in 1850. Farm Laborer in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 28, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District No. 2, p. 199A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 157.
Find A Grave, "Charles Nicholas "Nick" Davis (June 10, 1839-July 12, 1900)," Memorial #92511013, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92511013 (accessed January 12 2020).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 432.
